programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo visit a resort in Spain to create a trophy garden for a pro-am tennis tournament run by a former champion. programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. A member of the cast gets an attack of stage fright, and Laura is obliged to take her place in the play as the duo try to find the culprit. Drama, with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries

programme.desc: The lads receive an emergency call while on jungle manoeuvres Down Under, and rush off to Hope Bay, the village adjacent to their camp, which has just been devastated by a cyclone. Taylor manfully puts affairs of the heart on hold to supervise rescue operations, but unfortunately, not everyone can be saved.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave and Donna's relationship is threatened, and Paddy Garvey and Nancy Thorpe make some important decisions. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Reg Hollis and Tony Stamp observe drugs being brought into Stonewall women's prison through the visitors' hall as corrupt officers turn a blind eye. Jo Masters realises Cath Wilson has used her to establish herself as top dog on the wing and sets out to get revenge. Yvonne Hemmingway is sorely tempted when her ex Nick pleads for a second chance. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mark and Tricia's anticipation of their honeymoon is ruined when a furious Chrissie discovers her mother's cancer has returned and demands to know why she was not told. Sam gets emotionally involved in the case of a teenage girl with hepatitis C whose parents seem to know little about her medical history, and Matt struggles to fight his growing attraction to patient Nikki.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max risks his reputation by going too far in his treatment of a drug addict on an eventful New Year's Eve, while Barney and Spencer are forced to put aside their differences long enough to rescue a patient from a life-threatening situation. Holly receives a shock in the form of a mystery birthday card from Patrick's secret admirer. Drama with the staff of Holby's accident and emergency department, starring Robert Gwilym, Ronnie McCann and Ben Keaton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel sets about looking for a job. David is pleased to receive a visit from the police, and the financial noose tightens around Frank's neck.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is under pressure to keep his promise to burn down Frank's Autos, but Frank's plans don't go according to plan.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A car crash leads to an unusual rescue for the squad. Meanwhile, Nick gets a surprise when he returns home. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack's mountain rescue skills are put to the test when a kidney transplant patient is lost during a storm. Back at the practice, Will tries to deal with his personal problems. Kevin Whately, Amanda Burton and Simon Shepherd star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Denise Van Outen joins the cast as new district nurse Kim, a single parent with a shady past who doesn't take kindly to anyone prying into her affairs. Beth begins to have second thoughts as she and Tom prepare to leave the village, especially when friend Hattie reveals she has terminal cancer, and Ozias Harding takes up the reins at the factory once more. Prunella Scales guest stars.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey decides to make an effort with her in-laws for Darryl's sake - but soon lives to regret it. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy. The death of her husband leaves upper-class snob Audrey fforbes-Hamilton a widow in drastically reduced circumstances, with her beloved ancestral pile up for auction. Starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour vows that the days of Edie having to carry a dustbin are over, and promises to install a waste disposal unit for her. Meanwhile, a former wartime comrade of Wally's makes an appearance. Michael Aldridge, Thora Hird and Joe Gladwin star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Having witnessed his sister Edie fail several driving tests, Seymour gallantly volunteers to help teach her. However, because he is unable to control a vehicle himself, he needs a qualified motorist to ride along. Michael Aldridge and Thora Hird star.

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Celebrity portrait painter Agatha Troy asks Alleyn to investigate the death of a venerable Shakespearean actor whose portrait she had been commissioned to paint. Drama, starring Patrick Malahide, with Belinda Lang.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sasha is forced to work with her ex-husband Ned Hancock when their teams investigate the death of film critic Oliver Houghton, whose body was discovered floating in the Thames. UCOS delves into the victim's past and explores his link to the murder of a conceptual artist 20 years previously, while Hancock's knowledge of London's hidden past proves invaluable when a piece of occult footage from the 1970s plunges the investigators into the macabre world of human sacrifice. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance by Barnaby Kay.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is asked to help the police investigate the case of two brothers found dead in a police cell - but subsequent developments force her to confront the unpalatable truth about her involvement in a murder inquiry 13 years previously.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A car crash leads to an unusual rescue for the squad. Meanwhile, Nick gets a surprise when he returns home. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Brad Connor is devastated to learn he may be HIV positive, and makes a drunken pass at Marsha Stubbs. Joy Wilton discovers the joys of mixing work with pleasure.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy is forced to face his fear of heights head-on, and Army widow Joy Wilton gets a second chance at happiness, while Michael and Marsha's marriage shows further signs of crumbling. Starring Ben Nealon, Rob Spendlove, Denise Welch and Meera Syal.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tricia is rushed back to the hospital after the crash, but Mark's return is delayed when he fails a breath test and finds himself accused of drink-driving. Once out of the police station, he returns to Holby - where horrifying news awaits him. Sam turns detective to discover the truth about Jade's medical background, and Lola almost catches Matt and Nikki in a passionate clinch.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A drug user's angry mother refuses to be pacified and directs her fury at Max. Charlie embarks on a course of action in a bid to win back his son, and Holly receives flowers from a secret admirer. Meanwhile, the paramedics rush to a remote cottage where a boy has been knocked unconscious. Medical drama, starring Robert Gwilym and Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil receives some devastating news from Kathy. Frank faces up to an unpleasant reality. Shelley gets caught up in a Fowler feud, and Mark discovers he has a fairy godmother.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard decides to seek out his secret admirer, while Cindy is confused by Ian's behaviour.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to rescue a familiar face, and a collapsing building traps an elderly woman. Starring Andrew Kazamia and Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack struggles to save an asthmatic schoolgirl's life when her mother will only resort to faith healing. Meanwhile, Will has survived his breakdown and is eager to go back to work, determined he and Sarah will resolve their problems. Drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Stubborn postmistress Evie does her best to make Kim feel unwelcome, but a secret from her past soon explains the shopkeeper's icy attitude. Billy is shocked when he gets the job at the factory, David and Megan come to terms with their news, and Nathan lands himself in trouble. Drama, guest starring Elaine Paige.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon tries to make the best of her job at the bakery and Dorien joins the Open University, while Tracey continues to study at the school of hard knocks. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey moves out of Grantleigh Manor, and Richard and his mother move in, disappointing the former resident with their new ways. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour comes up with another madcap scheme to harness the power of nature using an old sail, a pair of roller skates and, in Compo, a very gullible 'test pilot'. Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: When You Take a Good Bite, Yorkshire Tastes Terrible
programme.desc: When Clegg receives news of an old friend dying in America, Compo and Seymour join him on a journey down memory lane, recalling time spent at school walking on gates and climbing trees - forgetting, of course, that it was many years ago. Poignant instalament of the long-running comedy, featuring the final appearance of Joe Gladwin as Wally Batty.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate mysterious goings-on when a woman dies after being picked from the audience to assist a magician in a stage trick.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A local journalist tries to convince the people of Lighthaven there is a big cat on the moors, but nobody will believe him - until the discovery of his mauled body.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a Roman sword with traces of blood on it is linked to an unidentified, headless corpse found near Heathrow in March 2008. It leads the team members to a lock-up belonging to a bodybuilder called Mark Rix, who died of a suspected heart attack the same year, so they start looking for connections between the original murder and Rix's death. They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Tracy-Ann Obermann and Liz White guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Sam is not convinced a sports agent committed suicide, after a post-mortem reveals she was in the early stages of pregnancy and bruising to her arms suggests a sexual assault. Matters are complicated further when a client she was planning a new life with is found dead in her flat and tests reveal the father of her baby is Caucasian, putting her husband back in the frame, despite his alibi.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that Fizz is a hat he is going to wear for his romantic date with Marnie. That's bad enough, but Fizz has a very important job to do!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: At the supermarket, Magoo mixes his shopping cart up with a baby stroller. Fizz decides to save the toddler and become a media star..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks Weasel has opened a restaurant, and wants to help him improve it. He mistakes the FizzLab for a kitchen!.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The Mikkelsens have pizza and the raccoons will do anything to get it. Can Mike hold them off for long enough for his owners to enjoy their dinner?.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons break into the Mikkelsens' and Mercury stumbles upon a didgeridoo and just can't get enough of it. Can Mike shut them up?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean looks back over his life, recalling how he acquired his beloved teddy bear and learned to drive. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A mysterious furry pink animal moves in with Bean, who doesn't know what it is but can't bring himself to get rid of such an odd creature.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Get ready for awesome action adventures with Rath! Taking out villains is all part of the fun for this hero. His mission - to save the day!.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Sickening Fumes of Smartsy Fartsy
programme.desc: The boys create a smart gas cloud to steal Mr Krupp's rulebook, but it turns against them..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: If there were two things Dave could wish for it would be for Fuzzypeg to smell better, and for Gran to be nicer. Is getting what you want always a good thing?.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James presents more highlights from the series, as well as preparing prawn biryani, French onion soup, and fig gateau, and providing a masterclass on steamed sponge pudding. Plus, James' culinary tour of Cornwall and recipes from chefs Clare Smyth, Atul Kochhar and Richard Bertinet.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Clare Smyth for a tour of the Lake District. They visit the Windermere Jetty Museum and take a trip on the lake in a traditional steam-powered boat. They also visit the farmers who supply the meat for Clare's restaurant and discover the secrets behind the region's famous sticky toffee pudding.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is still in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. In the seaside city of Aqaba he uses local molasses in a fattoush salad, and cooks with the chefs at a swanky golf club, where roasted fish with spicy rice is the order of the day. Ainsley also visits the city of Petra, learning the history of the Bedouin people and exploring the astonishing Treasury building. Back in his kitchen, chicken shawarma with tahini sauce and pitta bread packed with spiced beef mince are the final dishes on the menu.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team are in Doncaster, where Stewart Hofgartner assesses a vintage camera and Fay Rutter hopes to pocket a handsome timepiece.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five university friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 2018 World Cup: England v Colombia - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces a look back at the memorable last-16 tie at Otkritie Arena, Moscow, which was decided by a penalty shootout. Original coverage presented by Mark Pougatch, with analysis from Ian Wright, Lee Dixon and Gary Neville, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara host the grand final of the obstacle course challenge, with the final five competitors from across the nation testing their strength, speed and courage. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian takes a trip down memory lane as he presents a series of classic TV game shows, which have all been updated with a new final round offering the contestants a chance to win big. The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. The hopefuls are daytime stalwarts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, comedian Chris Ramsey and his wife Rosie, presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia, and singer-actress Martine McCutcheon and her husband Jack McManus.

programme.title: Captain America: Civil War (2016)
programme.desc: The superhuman soldier is propelled into conflict with his Avengers teammate Iron Man over a system of government control over their actions - a situation made worse when an old friend is accused of being behind a terror attack. As a cunning conspiracy surrounds them all, Captain America finds himself battling former allies, vengeful enemies, and new heroes on the block Black Panther and Spider-Man. Superhero adventure, starring Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of 10 giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to £10,000

programme.desc: Dave gets a girlfriend who turns out to be an alien. And she turns out to bear a striking similarity to an everyday household item..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Anna is practising for the school cycling test and is good at it. Dave isn't quite as skilled, but with a new bike from his parents he really hopes to pass..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Michelin-starred chef Lisa Goodwin-Allen on a visit to the Isle of Man during the warm-up week for the famous TT race. James serves up proper biker food - pork burgers with a spicy apple sauce - and picks up some local Manx kippers to make soup. Lisa visits local organic juice producers before James joins TT legend John McGuinness as he and his team prepare for the race, treating the bikers to lamb chops with hispi cabbage and an olive glaze.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Nurse Maggie Simkiss cares for end of life patients and treats their emotional well-being as well as their direct medical needs. To say thank you for her hard work, Alan Titchmarsh and his team of green-fingered experts arrive at her Hull home and help transform the unkempt garden into a grown-up Mediterranean hideaway.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Advice on growing fruit and vegetables, with Alan sharing the tips and tricks he uses on his own plot, with his Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney joining in from their homes. From seriously stylish ways to grow veg anywhere to practical tips on what to plant and where, they show how to get gardens bursting with fruit, salad, herbs and vegetables to supply the table for the year ahead and beyond.

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.sub-title: The Good, The Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: Martin learns about animal exploitation - the good, the bad and the ugly. The actor visits Sri Lanka, where fishing for manta rays is legal, but a turtle sanctuary offers hope. In Thailand, he learns more about silk production - as well as a more animal-friendly alternative - and on the Australian Friday Island, he is shown the delicate art of growing pearls. Finally, in the Abrolhos islands, Martin learns about the most valuable catch in Australia's waters.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle attends the annual Ennerdale Show in the Lake District, where he takes part in some sheep-showing and gets to grips with some Cumbrian wrestling, while Liz Bonnin heads to the River Nith in south-west Scotland for a training day with the river rescue team. Guest reporter Sheila Hancock returns to the quiet corner of the Dorset coast where she first fell in love with the countryside almost 80 years ago.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty presents as eight celebrity families take part in this knockout tournament, hoping to win £25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The first episode is a battle of the soaps, as Coronation Street's Lucy Fallon (Bethany Platt) and her family take on former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson (Barry Evans) and his clan. Two new rounds have been added to this celebrity spin on the format - including an Observation round featuring cartoon images of Anne that put their memories to the test.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian takes a trip down memory lane as he presents a series of classic TV game shows, which have all been updated with a new final round offering the contestants a chance to win big. The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. The hopefuls are daytime stalwarts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, comedian Chris Ramsey and his wife Rosie, presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia, and singer-actress Martine McCutcheon and her husband Jack McManus.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park (1997)
programme.desc: Scientist Dr Ian Malcolm reluctantly joins a research team on the island where his employer first designed genetically engineered dinosaurs. Meanwhile, a big-game hunter takes the chance to bag the biggest prize of all - a Tyrannosaurus rex. Steven Spielberg's dinosaur adventure sequel, starring Jeff Goldblum, Julianne Moore, Pete Postlethwaite and Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Adam Garcia, Carol Decker, Holly Walsh and Rylan Clark-Neal pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)
programme.desc: British author Newt Scamander arrives in 1920s New York with a bagful of magical creatures as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but gets caught up in a conflict when some of the creatures in his care are accidentally released. With a strange dark force terrorising the city, Newt needs to find some allies to help him round-up the beasts, while saving his own skin in the meantime. Harry Potter prequel, starring Eddie Redmayne, Katherine Waterston and Colin Farrell.

programme.title: Die Another Day (2002)
programme.desc: James Bond is suspended from duty after being taken hostage in North Korea, but goes against orders to track down those who betrayed him. During the pursuit of the terrorist he was investigating before his capture, he discovers a connection with a British billionaire who has constructed a devastating orbital weapon. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Halle Berry, Toby Stephens, Judi Dench and John Cleese.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit the Cotswolds and Somerset, where finds include a set of milk churns and an old munitions shell.

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.desc: Pilot Iain Lawrence put his wife Sally on a pedestal.
